name: Search_Flight_Location

docs_row.name: Search_Flight_Location
docs_row.func_description: Find airports by their location, address, state, country, etc.

query.description: Names of airport, locations, cities, districts, places, countries, counties etc.

languagecode.description:
To obtain the response data in a specific language, enter the languagecode. languagecode can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getLanguages(Get Languages
) endpoint in Meta collection.

query.description: Names of airport, locations, cities, districts, places, countries, counties etc.

languagecode.description:
To obtain the response data in a specific language, enter the languagecode. languagecode can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getLanguages(Get Languages
) endpoint in Meta collection.

response_summary: The API response provides information about New York and its major airports. The city of New York, identified by the code "NYC," is located in the United States and serves as the primary destination. Two key airports serve this area: John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK) and Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR). JFK is situated approximately 21.4 kilometers from the city center, while Newark Liberty is slightly closer at around 18.7 kilometers. Both airports are linked to New York and share the same country and region details. The response includes images for each location, though they appear to be the same generic city photo for all entries. This data is useful for travelers looking to explore New York or transit through its major airports.
enhance_func_desc: This API is ideal for flight planning and destination searches. It retrieves location details including cities and airports based on a search query, helping travelers identify key transit points. The response includes distance from city centers, airport codes, and regional information. Users can filter results by language for localized responses. Essential for itinerary building and understanding travel logistics around major destinations.

enhanced_parameters.query: Search term for airports, cities, or regions (e.g., 'new' for New York).

id.description: Unique identifier for the location, combining the code and type (e.g., 'NYC.CITY' for New York City, 'JFK.AIRPORT' for John F. Kennedy International Airport).

type.description: Type of the location, such as 'CITY' for cities or 'AIRPORT' for airports.

name.description: Full name of the location (e.g., 'New York' for the city, 'John F. Kennedy International Airport' for the airport).

code.description: Short code representing the location (e.g., 'NYC' for New York City, 'JFK' for John F. Kennedy International Airport).

regionName.description: Name of the region where the location is situated (e.g., 'New York' for both the city and airports).

country.description: Country code where the location is located (e.g., 'US' for United States).

countryName.description: Full name of the country where the location is situated (e.g., 'United States').

photoUri.description: URL of a photo representing the location. Note: The same generic image is used for all entries in this response.

city.description: City code associated with the airport (e.g., 'NYC' for airports serving New York).

cityName.description: Name of the city associated with the airport (e.g., 'New York').

countryNameShort.description: Short form of the country name (e.g., 'US' for United States).

distanceToCity.description: Distance from the airport to the city center.

value.description: Numerical value representing the distance (e.g., 21.381514773782005 km for JFK).

unit.description: Unit of measurement for the distance (e.g., 'km' for kilometers).

parent.description: Parent location code, typically the city code the airport serves (e.g., 'NYC' for airports in New York).

region.description: Region code where the airport is located (e.g., 'NJ' for Newark Liberty International Airport).
